name: Lorelei's Limbo (Kiyopawn) (Kiyopawn)
description:
Entering home, you realize that things aren't as they usually were. Your memory becomes fuzzy, as demons begin to swarm your house. Your place has become literal hell. Run away from demons as you recall your memories in an unorthodox manner, in an attempt to escape from the hell YOU yourself caused.

Lorelei's Limbo is very unorthodox, I hope the unusual game play loop doesn't catch you too off guard. My friends say it's addictive but hard. Beginner's playtime can last up to an hour, but if you know what you're doing you could finish the game in 15 minutes. It may be more fun than it is scary, which is something that I've accepted. The game feel is very similar to that of fnaf, where you meet more enemies as you progress in repeated tests of skill. I am making a re imagining of this game in the side, some characters will be retained but the story is more simple and the game play loop is a little different.

If I were to really explain the game play loop, it's kinda like baldi's basics except you buy more story to progress with the in-game currency. The more you obtain the story, the more you obtain more threats. The Story? It's vague in the start but as you progress you'll figure things out.

Still can't convince you to buy the game? Then let's do a little test. How many amongst the following points do you like?

>RPGMaker Horror Games

>The Gameplay progression of FNAF games

>Challenging but Fair

>Horror games with Chase Sequences

>Rouge-likes

>Avant Garde Storytelling

>A game with many secret shortcuts

>When a game doesn't let the Story intrude you

>Surrealism

>A game PERFECT for Youtube Videos

If you like 8-10 of the points.

Then this game's for you.

If you like 7-5 of the points.

Still fairly confident in recommending this game for you, the game is challenging but holds your hand in learning what you must do to improve your skill in the game.

If you like 4-3 of the points.

This game is a rather mixed bag for you. See what someone else says and see if they can convince you to play it, otherwise... it's not an easy sale.

If you like 2-0 points.

Ehh, everyone has tastes, and the game doesn't fit your tastes.
